p: Suspension-cultured tobacco ( Nicotiana tabacum L. cv Bright Yellow-2) BY-2 cells ( Kato et al., 1972) were grown in darkness at 26°C on a rotary shaker at 130 rpm in modified Murashige–Skoog medium (Sigma, St-Quentin Fallavier, France). BY-2 cells were maintained and then prepared for biolistic bombardment as described previously ( Lingard et al., 2008), sub-culturing the cells every 7 days by transferring 1 mL into 50 mL of fresh medium.
